page.title: 01WOLD ARABLE FARMLAND
page.content: Because of the geology of the area the type of agriculture can be limited. In many parts of the Humberside Wolds the depth of soil may only be a few centi- metres. This can reduce the number of crops that can be successfully grown, crops such as potatoes and sugar beet are not very common on the wolds. But because of the free-draining characteristics of the land, it is possible to grow cereal crops, in many cases very efficiently. As well as mainly cereal crops, various break crops are used in the crop rotation including oil seed rape (used to produce vegetable oil) peas (far freezing and drying) etc. Most farms in the area keep some animals, sheep and beef cattle on the permanant pasture and grass legs which can be part of the arable rotation, intensive pigs are also a feature of the wolds.
